metadata.subject: Peter Thiel's Money Talks, in Contentious Ways. But What Does He Say?

analysis.purpose: To analyze Peter Thiel's controversial positions and influence in Silicon Valley and politics
analysis.significance: Provides insight into Thiel's relationships with Trump, Facebook, and his role in the Gawker lawsuit

notable_quotes: "It's still better than Hillary Clinton or the Republican zombies," he said, referring to the other candidates.
"The Trump campaign slogan, 'Make America Great Again,' was perhaps the single most offensive thing you could say to Silicon Valley," he said.
"Gawker was trying to cut people down to size for not conforming," he said.
red_flags: Secret financing of Hulk Hogan's lawsuit against Gawker
Large political donations to attorney general who then investigated Google

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion found in this news article

illegal_activity.description: This is a news article reporting on Peter Thiel's activities and statements, not first-hand evidence of illegal activity

details: References to New York Times coverage
Mentions media reports about Thiel-Trump relationship

public_knowledge.context: This is a published New York Times article about Peter Thiel's controversial positions and influence, making it public knowledge

analysis.summary: New York Times article profiling Peter Thiel's controversial positions, including his support for Donald Trump, role on Facebook's board during Russian interference revelations, secret financing of the Gawker lawsuit, and political donations to Missouri's attorney general who later investigated Google.
